title: Explanatory Writing on the Respiratory System: Comparative Process Between Guided Inquiry Learning (GIL) and Problem-Based Learning (PBL)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Biology and Anatomy Knowledge, Along with Fundamental Writing Skills
context.additional_context: Course for simultaneously acquiring specialized understanding of the respiratory system and explanatory writing skills, requiring class design that encourages active participation of small online learner groups. Learners engage flexibly in activities using personal devices

learning_goals: Enhancement of scientific writing skills to accurately explain the structure and function of the respiratory system
Understanding the differences between GIL and PBL methodologies and applying writing strategies according to each approach
Submission of a project outcome systematically describing causes, symptoms, and treatments by analyzing respiratory disease cases
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
